subject: DNA (Deoxyribonucleic Acid)
Football
lead_paragraph: The body of George Gipp, the Notre Dame player who inspired the rallying cry “Win one for the Gipper,” was exhumed recently for DNA testing in his Upper Peninsula hometown, Traverse City, Mich. The test was sought by the Gipp family and met legal requirements, the Houghton County medical examiner said, although it angered some relatives who live in the area where Gipp was born and raised. The medical examiner’s office declined comment about why the request was made. An ESPN crew taped the exhumation for a coming report, but a spokesman for the network said it played no role in arranging it.
